document_data.name: Jade Palace of the Necromancers
document_data.aliases: Jade Palace of Zoraya, the Jade Palace
document_data.mainbody: The '''Jade Palace of the Necromancers''', also called the '''Jade Palace of Zoraya''' or simply the '''Jade Palace''', was a prominent structure found in the city of [[Ysawis]] within the [[Grey Jungle]] of the [[Cities of the Ancients]] region of [[east Zakhara]] in [[1367 DR]].{{AQ-time}}

Structure.Northern Court: The northern court was originally designed with defense in mind. This open courtyard stretched along the entire length of the Palace's northern wall. The northern court was filled with well-manicured lawns as of 1367 DR.
Structure.Main Gatehouse: The main gatehouse was a two-storied fortification complete with four [[ballista]]e located on the western side of the outer north wall. [[Juju zombie]]s armed with [[crossbow]]s were stationed here.
Structure.Galleries: Vaults lined the walls of the northern court. Most contained simple gardening tools, but some were stocked with weapons and [[armor]].
Structure.Riding Court: The packed-dirt of the courtyard running the length of the western outer wall was once used to train the royal horses.
Structure.Royal Stables: The stables were located in between the riding court and the western outer wall of the palace. Bizarre steeds such as [[ghost mount]]s, [[skeleton|skeletal horses]], and even a [[Zakharan roc]] were housed here and attended by [[zombie]] grooms.
Structure.Flower Gardens: The gardens were tended by various undead who maintained rows of [[violet]]s, [[gardenia]]s, and [[orchid]]s during all hours. A circular pool was located in the center of the gardens.
Structure.Guest Rooms: A multitude of guest rooms and parlors surrounded the flower gardens. Each was decorated with carved [[jade]] panels of varying colors from bone white to red and green.

document_data.Interior:
The throne room was decorated with dark green [[jade]] carved panels depicting the conquests of King [[Kagemni]]. A pair of massive jade thrones dominated the throne room. Each weighed {{SI|6000|lbs|k|long=yes}}.

The riches of Ysawis were housed within the [[Gallery of Antiquities]]. The treasury was warded from unwanted intruders with ''[[Symbol of insanity|symbols of insanity]]'' and a cadre of malevolent [[spectre]]s.

An overgrown mini jungle within the palace, called the [[King's Garden]], served as a morbid [[undead]] zoo for [[Sumulael]] to monitor is undead monstrous creations.
document_data.Defenses:
An elite force of at least 1,000 undead guarded the Jade Palace including undead monsters, ju-ju zombies, and undead [[jungle giant]]s.

The [[necromancer]]s [[Kazerabet]] and Sumulael added [[Scrying (spell)|antiscrying]] and [[Teleport|antiteleportation]] [[ward]]s in their separate private chambers within the palace. Both necromancers utilized the ''[[improved skull watch]]'' spell to decorate the palace with magical skull sentries that they could communicate with telepathically. Each necromancer had sixteen such skull watchers.

All of the corridors and halls within the Palace were enchanted with ''[[continual light]]'' spells, making it extremely difficult to navigate the Palace by stealth. Furthermore, undead servants prowled the halls at all hours of the day carrying out their designated tasks.

An elite core of 300 ju-ju zombies were outfitted with ancient [[banded mail]] and [[shield]]s bearing the ancient symbols of Ysawisâ€“a [[griffon]] and [[vishap]]. The majority of ju-ju zombies wielded [[spear]]s or [[scimitar]]s as weapons, but some carried crossbows or some form of [[polearm]]. 

A dozen powerful undead jungle giant slaves, previously of the [[Silent Arrow Clan]], served as elite guards.
document_data.History: The palace was originally referred to as the Jade Palace of [[Zoraya]] long ago when Ysawis still stood as a mighty city.
document_data.Rumors & Legends: Princess Zoraya was rumored to be buried with the legendary [[Talisman of Shajar]] in a secret mausoleum hidden somewhere within the Jade Palace.
document_data.Inhabitants: The undead roaming the Palace would ignore approved visitors unless they turned hostile. Guests caught sneaking around in unauthorized areas would be detained by the undead and interrogated by lieutenants. Punishment for being caught unininvited within the private sections of the palace was meted out by either Sumulael or Kazerabet.
